direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods manipulate the composite array of maps with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods modify the state of the composite maps, though clear() removes all mappings while removeComposited removes a specific map.
Both methods involve mutation operations on the composite map, though put() adds or updates a key-value pair while removeComposited removes a map.
Both methods handle potential exceptions related to map operations, such as unsupported operations or null keys.
Both methods interact with the mutator, though setMutator() configures it while removeComposited uses it implicitly.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the composite map to be initialized before performing operations.
Environment setup is required before removing a map from the composite.
Both methods verify the state of the composite map and handle similar exceptions.
